dcterms:creator: Emma Lejeune
dcterms:description: The BIC dataset contains three sub-datasets: 'BIC 1', 'BIC 2', and 'BIC 3' that differ only in their input parameter distribution. The input is the material property distribution of a heterogeneous column that is then subject to a fixed level of applied compressive displacement. The output corresponds to class 'Stable' or 'Unstable' based on the results of a Finite Element Analysis (FEA) simulation.
dcterms:title: Buckling Instability Classification (BIC)

dcterms:creator: Peerasait Prachaseree
Emma Lejeune
dcterms:description: The ABC dataset contains three subdatasets, where each subdataset corresponds to a different algorithm for generating the geometry of the input domain. The columns are subjected to fixed-fixed boundary conditions and are compressed until the onset of buckling. Each input geometry in the ABC dataset is then classified as buckling 'left' or 'right.'
dcterms:title: Asymmetric Buckling Columns (ABC)

dcterms:creator: Saeed Mohammadzadeh
Emma Lejeune
dcterms:description: The Mechanical MNIST dataset collection is a collection of benchmark datasets initially conceptualized as mechanics-relevant drop-in replacements for the popular MNIST dataset. The 'Mechanical MNIST – Crack Path' dataset is an example where the input bitmap distribution is a heterogeneous pattern of inclusions derived from the Fashion MNIST dataset, and the main output is a damage field predicted by a linear elastic phase-field fracture simulation.
dcterms:title: Mechanical MNIST – Crack Path
